title: 103_s1122
content: The Act is titled the "Department of Veterans Affairs Health Professionals Education Debt Reduction Act." It introduces a program to assist certain Veterans Health Administration employees in paying off their education debts. The Department of Veterans Affairs Education Debt Reduction Program, authorized under Sec. 7661, aims to help health-care personnel in the Veterans Health Administration reduce educational debt. Eligibility for the program, outlined in Sec. 7662, includes individuals other than physicians or dentists. The Reduction Program is for individuals in the Veterans Health Administration who owe educational loans used for qualifying degrees. The Education Debt Reduction Program provides assistance to eligible individuals who have completed a course of education leading to a qualifying degree. Preference is given to individuals who have completed a two-year or four-year course at an undergraduate institution and those serving in the Veterans Health Administration. The Education Debt Reduction Program offers assistance to individuals serving in the Veterans Health Administration in difficult recruitment areas or positions. The Secretary may provide up to $4,000 per year for individuals serving in eligible positions. The Education Debt Reduction Program provides assistance to individuals in the Veterans Health Administration for paying off loans. Assistance is limited to $12,000 and requires full-year service in eligible positions with acceptable performance levels. The Education Debt Reduction Program in the Veterans Health Administration offers up to $12,000 in assistance for loan repayment, contingent on a full-year service in eligible positions with satisfactory performance levels. Additionally, section 7631 of the title is adjusted accordingly. "Education Debt Reduction Program in the Veterans Health Administration provides up to $12,000 for loan repayment with a full-year service requirement in eligible positions." The Education Debt Reduction Program in the Veterans Health Administration offers up to $12,000 for loan repayment with a full-year service requirement in eligible positions. The program includes eligibility criteria, preference for assistance, and details on the amount of assistance available. Amendments have been made to Section 7631 of title 38, United States Code, to include the maximum Selected Reserve stipend amount and education debt reduction amount and limitation. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish regulations for the Education Debt Reduction Program within 90 days of the enactment of the Act. A report on the program's effectiveness must be submitted to Congress within one year of the Act's enactment. The Education Debt Reduction Program, established under title 38, United States Code, assists in recruiting and retaining health-care professionals for the Veterans Health Administration. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 1994 to 1998. No funds can be used without specific appropriation. The program is exempt from certain limitations.
